api/Linkset.Link.html.title: Class Link | Linkset Documentation
api/Linkset.Link.html.summary: Class Link Namespace Linkset Assembly Linkset.dll Represents a single link in a linkset as defined in RFC 9264 and RFC 8288. public class Link Inheritance object Link Properties Anchor The context URI of the link (optional). If not present, the context is the linkset itself. [JsonPropertyName("anchor")] public string? Anchor { get; set; } Property Value string ExtensionData Extension attributes not defined in the standard. [JsonExtensionData] public Dictionary<string, object>? ExtensionData { get; set; } Property Value Dictionary<string, object> Href The target URI of the link (required). [JsonPropertyName("href")] public string Href { get; set; } Property Value string Hreflang The language of the target resource (optional). [JsonPropertyName("hreflang")] public string? Hreflang { get; set; } Property Value string Length The length/size of the target resource in bytes (optional). [JsonPropertyName("length")] public long? Length { get; set; } Property Value long? Rel The relation type(s) of the link (optional). Can be a registered relation type or an extension relation type (URI). [JsonPropertyName("rel")] public string? Rel { get; set; } Property Value string Title A human-readable title for the link (optional). [JsonPropertyName("title")] public string? Title { get; set; } Property Value string Type The media type of the target resource (optional). [JsonPropertyName("type")] public string? Type { get; set; } Property Value string

api/Linkset.LinksetDocument.html.title: Class LinksetDocument | Linkset Documentation
api/Linkset.LinksetDocument.html.summary: Class LinksetDocument Namespace Linkset Assembly Linkset.dll Represents a linkset document as defined in RFC 9264. The document contains an array of Link objects. public class LinksetDocument Inheritance object LinksetDocument Properties ExtensionData Extension data for additional properties not defined in the standard. [JsonExtensionData] public Dictionary<string, object>? ExtensionData { get; set; } Property Value Dictionary<string, object> Linkset The array of links in the linkset. [JsonPropertyName("linkset")] public List<Link>? Linkset { get; set; } Property Value List<Link> Methods GetAllRelationTypes() Gets all distinct relation types present in the linkset. public List<string> GetAllRelationTypes() Returns List<string> A list of distinct relation types. GetFirstLinkByRel(string) Gets the first link with the specified relation type, or null if not found. public Link? GetFirstLinkByRel(string rel) Parameters rel string The relation type to find. Returns Link The first link with the specified relation type, or null if not found. GetLinksByRel(string) Gets all links with the specified relation type. public List<Link> GetLinksByRel(string rel) Parameters rel string The relation type to filter by. Returns List<Link> A list of links with the specified relation type. GetLinksByType(string) Gets all links with the specified media type. public List<Link> GetLinksByType(string type) Parameters type string The media type to filter by. Returns List<Link> A list of links with the specified media type.

api/Linkset.LinksetParseException.html.title: Class LinksetParseException | Linkset Documentation
api/Linkset.LinksetParseException.html.summary: Class LinksetParseException Namespace Linkset Assembly Linkset.dll Exception thrown when parsing a linkset document fails. public class LinksetParseException : Exception Inheritance object Exception LinksetParseException Constructors LinksetParseException() Initializes a new instance of the LinksetParseException class. public LinksetParseException() LinksetParseException(string) Initializes a new instance of the LinksetParseException class with a specified error message. public LinksetParseException(string message) Parameters message string The error message that explains the reason for the exception. LinksetParseException(string, Exception) Initializes a new instance of the LinksetParseException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception. public LinksetParseException(string message, Exception innerException) Parameters message string The error message that explains the reason for the exception. innerException Exception The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

api/Linkset.LinksetParser.html.title: Class LinksetParser | Linkset Documentation
api/Linkset.LinksetParser.html.summary: Class LinksetParser Namespace Linkset Assembly Linkset.dll Parser for application/linkset+json documents as defined in RFC 9264. public class LinksetParser Inheritance object LinksetParser Constructors LinksetParser() Initializes a new instance of the LinksetParser with default options. public LinksetParser() LinksetParser(JsonSerializerOptions) Initializes a new instance of the LinksetParser with custom JSON serializer options. public LinksetParser(JsonSerializerOptions options) Parameters options JsonSerializerOptions Custom JSON serializer options. Methods Parse(string) Parses a linkset JSON string into a LinksetDocument. public LinksetDocument Parse(string json) Parameters json string The JSON string to parse. Returns LinksetDocument The parsed LinksetDocument. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when json is null or empty. JsonException Thrown when the JSON is malformed. LinksetParseException Thrown when the linkset structure is invalid. ParseAsync(Stream) Parses a linkset JSON stream into a LinksetDocument. public Task<LinksetDocument> ParseAsync(Stream stream) Parameters stream Stream The stream containing the JSON to parse. Returns Task<LinksetDocument> The parsed LinksetDocument. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when stream is null. JsonException Thrown when the JSON is malformed. LinksetParseException Thrown when the linkset structure is invalid. Serialize(LinksetDocument) Serializes a LinksetDocument to a JSON string. public string Serialize(LinksetDocument document) Parameters document LinksetDocument The LinksetDocument to serialize. Returns string The JSON string representation. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when document is null. SerializeAsync(LinksetDocument, Stream) Serializes a LinksetDocument to a stream. public Task SerializeAsync(LinksetDocument document, Stream stream) Parameters document LinksetDocument The LinksetDocument to serialize. stream Stream The stream to write to. Returns Task Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when document or stream is null.

api/Linkset.html.title: Namespace Linkset | Linkset Documentation
api/Linkset.html.summary: Namespace Linkset Classes Link Represents a single link in a linkset as defined in RFC 9264 and RFC 8288. LinksetDocument Represents a linkset document as defined in RFC 9264. The document contains an array of Link objects. LinksetParseException Exception thrown when parsing a linkset document fails. LinksetParser Parser for application/linkset+json documents as defined in RFC 9264.

index.html.title: Linkset Documentation | Linkset Documentation
index.html.summary: Linkset Documentation Parse and serialize linkset documents according to RFC 9264 and RFC 8288. What is Linkset? Linkset is a .NET library that provides support for parsing and serializing linkset documents. Linksets are structured collections of web links that can be represented in JSON format, enabling efficient discovery and processing of link relationships between web resources. Installation Install via NuGet: dotnet add package SpecWorks.Linkset Features ✅ RFC 9264 Compliant - Full implementation of Linkset specification ✅ RFC 8288 Compliant - Web Linking support ✅ Parse Linkset Documents - Parse JSON linkset documents ✅ Serialize Linksets - Generate valid linkset JSON ✅ Link Validation - Validate link structure and relationships ✅ Type-Safe API - Strong typing with nullable reference types ✅ Multi-Target - Supports .NET 10.0 and .NET 8.0 (LTS) Quick Start Parsing Linkset Documents using SpecWorks.Linkset; // Parse from JSON string string linksetJson = @"{ ""linkset"": [ { ""anchor"": ""https://example.com/resource"", ""item"": [ { ""href"": ""https://example.com/chapter1"", ""type"": ""text/html"" } ] } ] }"; var linksetDocument = LinksetParser.Parse(linksetJson); // Access linksets foreach (var linkset in linksetDocument.Linksets) { Console.WriteLine($"Anchor: {linkset.Anchor}"); foreach (var link in linkset.Links) { Console.WriteLine($" Link: {link.Href}"); Console.WriteLine($" Relation: {link.Relation}"); Console.WriteLine($" Type: {link.Type}"); } } Creating Linkset Documents using SpecWorks.Linkset; // Create a linkset document var linksetDocument = new LinksetDocument(); // Create a linkset with an anchor var linkset = new Linkset { Anchor = new Uri("https://example.com/resource") }; // Add links linkset.AddLink(new Link { Href = new Uri("https://example.com/chapter1"), Relation = "item", Type = "text/html", Title = "Chapter 1" }); linkset.AddLink(new Link { Href = new Uri("https://example.com/chapter2"), Relation = "item", Type = "text/html", Title = "Chapter 2" }); linksetDocument.Linksets.Add(linkset); // Serialize to JSON string json = linksetDocument.ToJson(); Console.WriteLine(json); Working with Link Relations using SpecWorks.Linkset; var linksetDocument = LinksetParser.Parse(linksetJson); // Find links by relation type var itemLinks = linksetDocument .GetLinksByRelation("item") .ToList(); foreach (var link in itemLinks) { Console.WriteLine($"Item: {link.Href}"); } // Find links by anchor var anchorLinks = linksetDocument .GetLinksByAnchor(new Uri("https://example.com/resource")) .ToList(); Use Cases Resource Discovery Enable discovery of related resources: // Parse linkset from HTTP response var response = await httpClient.GetAsync("/linkset"); var linksetJson = await response.Content.ReadAsStringAsync(); var linkset = LinksetParser.Parse(linksetJson); // Discover related resources var relatedResources = linkset .GetLinksByRelation("related") .Select(link => link.Href) .ToList(); Navigation Structures Represent navigation hierarchies: var linkset = new Linkset { Anchor = new Uri("https://example.com/book") }; // Table of contents linkset.AddLink(new Link { Href = new Uri("https://example.com/toc"), Relation = "contents", Type = "text/html" }); // Chapters for (int i = 1; i <= 10; i++) { linkset.AddLink(new Link { Href = new Uri($"https://example.com/chapter{i}"), Relation = "item", Type = "text/html", Title = $"Chapter {i}" }); } API Link Collections Provide structured link collections in APIs: // Create linkset for API response var linkset = new Linkset { Anchor = new Uri("https://api.example.com/users/123") }; linkset.AddLink(new Link { Href = new Uri("https://api.example.com/users/123"), Relation = "self" }); linkset.AddLink(new Link { Href = new Uri("https://api.example.com/users/123/posts"), Relation = "related", Title = "User Posts" }); linkset.AddLink(new Link { Href = new Uri("https://api.example.com/users/123/profile"), Relation = "alternate", Type = "text/html" }); // Return as part of API response return Ok(linkset.ToJson()); API Reference API Documentation - Complete API reference Specification Compliance This library implements: RFC 9264 - Linkset: Media Types and a Link Relation Type for Link Sets RFC 8288 - Web Linking Supported Features Feature RFC Section Status Linkset JSON Format RFC 9264, Section 4.2 ✅ Supported Link Target Attributes RFC 8288, Section 3.4 ✅ Supported Link Context RFC 8288, Section 3.2 ✅ Supported Link Relations RFC 8288, Section 3.3 ✅ Supported Extension Relations RFC 8288, Section 2.1.2 ✅ Supported Link Attributes The library supports all standard link attributes: href - Link target URI (required) rel - Link relation type anchor - Link context URI type - Media type hint title - Human-readable title hreflang - Language of target resource media - Media query for the link Requirements .NET 10.0 or .NET 8.0 (LTS) C# 10.0 or later Source Code View the source code on GitHub. Contributing Contributions welcome! See the repository for: Issue tracking Pull request guidelines Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) License MIT License - see LICENSE for details. Links GitHub Repository: github.com/spec-works/linkset RFC 9264: rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9264 RFC 8288: rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8288 SpecWorks Factory: spec-works.github.io
